speaker: MLefebvreICO
text: Just received update `1.47.1` linking to this issue, but it doesn't have details 😐

speaker: kieferrm
text: I updated the link. The MITRE copy is not yet updated.

speaker: aaomidi
text: The link currently just goes to this milestone (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/milestone/128), is that expected?

speaker: vp2177
text:
> Details in https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-us/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1416

That page is currently empty, so is https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-1416

However, if anyone is wondering, just google (_bing_?) the CVE number.

speaker: jlk
text: The milestone page is "empty," but if you click "closed" you'll see it. Probably should tweak the link to show closed issues.

speaker: wwahammy
text: Is there a commit/PR we can see fixing this bug? It's not super helpful to know a CVE existed if we can't verify that it was fixed properly.

speaker: ExE-Boss
text: @wwahammy It seems like the bug was [in the closed source `vscode‑distro` component](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Differences-between-the-repository-and-Visual-Studio-Code): https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/compare/1.47.0...1.47.1.

speaker: wwahammy
text: Ah, so there's some proprietary software that VSCode uses that apparently does something which can lead to a security hole. We don't know what it does or how risky it is to run.

speaker: mahen23
text: This is the kind of coding quality we get when corporations prioritizes employee diversity over code quality

speaker: jlk
text: A thumbs down isn't enough on this one. There's zero tolerance for backwater attitude @mahen23. Reporting.
